_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Vertellus Agriculture and Nutrition Specialties, LLC (Vertellus), located in Indianapolis, Indiana, is a specialty chemical manufacturing company.  This facility was formerly owned by Reilly Industries, Inc. and previous RMP submissions are under the Reilly Industries, Inc. name.  Vertellus is committed to the protection of the environment and to the safety and health of its employees and communities.  This commitment incorporates the safe and environmentally sound development, manufacture, distribution, use and disposal of its products.  In addition, as a member of the American Chemistry Council, Vertellus has pledged commitment to the Responsible CareA? Program.  The Guiding Principles of Responsible Care require Vertellus to make continuous progress towards the vision of no accidents, injuries or harm to the environment.  Responsible Care has six codes of Management Practice, two of which are particularly relevant to RMP.

The Community Awareness and Emergency Response (CAER) Code addresses community outreach and emergency response.  The goal of the CAER Code is to assure emergency preparedness and to foster community right-to-know.  As a result of the CAER Code, Vertellus meets quarterly with the surrounding neighborhood to keep the neighbors informed on Vertellus activities and to discuss any concerns the community may have.  

The Process Safety Code addresses process safety and, at a minimum, incorporates OSHA's process safety management system regulation.  Vertellus has been in full practice with all codes of Responsible Care since the end of 1997.

The RMP chemicals handled at this plant include anhydrous acetaldehyde, anhydrous ammonia, piperidine, and hydrogen.  Vertellus uses an aqueous formaldehyde (52%) and methanol solution in multiple processes throughout the facility that was reported on previous RMP submissions.  Though the formaldehyde solution was included in the previous two RMP submissions for the facility, upon further r

eview the determination was made that the mixture does not qualify for inclusion based on the vapor pressure of the solution [40 CFR 68.115(b)(1)].

This Executive Summary includes a brief description of the overall Accident Prevention Program, Five Year Accident History, and the Emergency Response Program.  Finally, the summary includes a brief overview of safety improvement projects.

Accident Prevention Program
The Vertellus accident prevention program is based on both OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation and the Responsible Care Process Safety Code.  Vertellus has developed a process safety system for all processes at the plant, including non-RMP and non-OSHA processes.

Five Year Accident History
Vertellus had no accidental releases of covered substances over the past five (5) years that meet the RMP reporting requirements. An RMP reportable accidental release from a covered process is one which results in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage (40 CFR 68.42).  Though no RMP reportable accidental releases have occurred at Vertellus over the past five years, Vertellus has opted to provide information on releases of significance of covered substances that are not required to be reported. 

The Vertellus five year accident history includes ten incidents, all involving the release of anhydrous ammonia in quantities of 2000 pounds or less but exceeded the RQ for ammonia.  None of the incidents resulted in serious injury or off-site impact; however, since the quantities released exceeded the RQ for ammonia, the required notifications were made.  In each case, though the required notification was made, no off-site assistance was deemed necessary and thus no off-site assistance was requested.  In order to prevent these incidents from recurring, standard procedures and proper protective equipment requirements were reviewed and equipment

was replaced or upgraded as was deemed warranted based on a thorough investigation of each incident.  

Emergency Response Program
The Vertellus emergency response program includes an emergency response plan that was prepared in accordance with OSHA and EPA (RCRA) requirements.  The plan is coordinated with the Local Emergency Planning Committee.  The program includes bringing the Indianapolis Fire Department on-site annually for joint training and inspections.  In addition, Vertellus has a telephone notification system that, in the event of an emergency, would communicate to the neighbors the appropriate protective actions to take.

Safety Improvement Projects
Vertellus has implemented a number of projects that demonstrate its commitment to overall safety.  Since the original filing of the RMP, chemical detection systems have been installed in certain process areas.  Security cameras to monitor rail lines, tanks and process areas have been placed in primary production areas.  Fall protection platforms for rail and tank access have been installed.  Vertellus will continue to review all offsite consequence analyses and initiate appropriate changes to mitigate uncovered impacts.
